snippet: The implosion of Building 877 on Sunday was the first such demolition in New York City since 2001, when a pair of 400-foot-tall natural-gas storage tanks was brought down in Brooklyn.
abstract: Eleven-story building on Governors Island, once home to members of the Coast Guard and their families, is successfully imploded to make way for a new park.

byline.original: By KIA GREGORY and RANDY LEONARD

lead_paragraph: The implosion of Building 877 on Sunday was the first such demolition in New York City since 2001, when a pair of 400-foot-tall natural-gas storage tanks was brought down in Brooklyn.

headline.seo: With Thunderous Blasts, a Governors Island Holdout Falls to Earth
headline.main: With Thunderous Blasts, a Governors Island Holdout Tumbles to Earth
headline.print_headline: With Thunderous Blasts, a Governors Island Holdout Tumbles to Earth
